SEARCH
Package util

Class LoadData

java.lang.Object
util.LoadData
public class LoadData extends Object
The LoadData class provides utility methods and static configurations for loading game resources

  • Constructor Details

    • LoadData

      public LoadData()

  • Method Details

    • getImage

      public static BufferedImage getImage(String path)
      Loads an image from a specified file path within the application's resource directory.
      Parameters:
      path - the relative path of the image file to be loaded, starting from the root of the resource directory
      Returns:
      the loaded BufferedImage if the file is successfully read; otherwise, returns null

    • getLevelData

      public static int[][] getLevelData(String fileName)
      Reads level data from a specified file and returns a 2D array representing the map tiles. The method parses the file line by line, splitting values into integers and assigning them to the corresponding positions in the 2D array.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file containing the level data to be loaded
      Returns:
      a 2D integer array representing the level's tile map where each element corresponds to a tile

    • loadEnemies

      public static ArrayList<Enemy> loadEnemies(String fileName)
      Loads enemy instances based on data from a specified file. The file is processed to generate a 2D array of integers representing the level design, where specific integer value corresponds to enemies. Each enemy is created and positioned based on this data.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file containing the level data used to populate enemies
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Enemy instances created based on the level data

    • loadItems

      public static ArrayList<Item> loadItems(String fileName)
      Loads item instances based on data from a specified file. The file is processed to generate a 2D array of integers representing the level design, where specific integer value corresponds items. Each item is created and positioned based on this data.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file containing the level data used to populate items
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Item instances created based on the level data
